thread.title: Crucifying the Springboks

author: news24.com
title: Crucifying the Springboks
text:
I do not think that it is the right thing to do to crucify our national rugby team like we are doing.
Certainly, the defeat against Japan should never have happened, but losing one battle does not cost you a war. Ask any military strategist.
The press, especially the S.A.B.C. has hyped up everybody in the country to a feverish extent, but because they lost one match, now they have to be treated like outcasts!!!!.
If this is the support we give our fellow countrymen then I think we ought to be ashamed of ourselves.
This will only exacerbate the outflow of South Africa's most promising rugby talent.
After all who wants to be hung out to dry just because you lost one game.
A far better option would be to support our guys and to put this loss behind us. We simply cannot continue like this; it is demoralising not only to the country but also to the players.
It cannot be condoned since it is not fair to anyone, not the supporters, nor the players.
